description.plain:
Ne-Yo is a singer, songwriter, record producer, dancer, and actor who first gained notoriety when he wrote 2004’s hit “Let Me Love You” for singer, Mario.

Ne-Yo (who was born Shaffer C. Smith) got his stage name from collaborator and producer, Big D Evans, who claimed that Ne-Yo “sees music as Neo sees the matrix.”

In addition to eight studio albums, Ne-Yo has co-written with Tor Erik Hermansen and Mikkel S. Eriksen of the Norwegian production team, Stargate. His hits include Beyoncé’s “Irreplaceable” and Rihanna’s “Take a Bow”.

Most recently he appeared on the The Mindy Project, playing Marcus, a friend of Mindy’s love interest, Casey.

songs.full_title: So Sick by Ne-Yo
songs.title: So Sick

description.plain:
Although many believe this to be Ne-Yo’s début single, it was in fact his second single released prior to his debut album In My Own Words, and was his breakthrough in to the mainstream as a solo artist as the song peaked at number one in both the USA and UK.

This song was originally offered to British singer Jay Sean via his then record label Virgin Records, however they turned it down without consulting with him.

songs.full_title: Miss Independent by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Miss Independent

description.plain:
Released September 2008, this is Ne-Yo’s second single, going on to be certified double platinum by the RIAA and reaching number 7 on the US Billboard charts. The song won two Grammy awards, for the best R&B song and the best male R&B vocal performance in 2009.

The track is about a woman Ne-Yo covets, who he recognises is in charge of her own life, and doesn’t need the attention and money he showers upon other girls.

The music video features Ne-Yo dressed as a dapper businessman, losing his cool chasing this woman who doesn’t appear to need or even want him. It features performances from Lauren London, Gabrielle Union, Keri Hilson and even Trey Songz.

songs.full_title: Because of You by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Because of You

description.plain:
“Because of You” is a 2007 song by singer and songwriter Ne-Yo. It is the first single from his second album of the same name.
The single started radio play the week of February 4, 2007.

The song debuted on the Billboard Hot 100 at number 84 in March; it reached the top ten in May when it climbed from number 39 to number 5 in one week. The song has become his second-most successful song in the U.S., after his 2006 #1 hit “So Sick”. It reached a peak at number 2 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. It also peaked at number 4 in the UK.

The beat used is somehow unique in the R&B style. The main melodic instruments include muted harpsichord and guitar, whilst the groove uses a bass/clap beat combined together. The groove is heavily influenced by the disco style guitar with delay. The bass/clap beat, mixed with harpsichord, gave listeners an initial impression of the song being a remix, with which the effect is typically associated.

This type of beat would later appear in Ne-Yo’s 2008 hit “Closer”, which uses guitar with a bass/clap beat mixed with keyboard and chorus matching the vocals. Jay Sean was seemingly inspired by this style and created his song “Maybe”, incorporating the same groove, a song which he even sung later on this song’s beat:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VolMme13j0o

songs.full_title: She Knows by Ne-Yo (Ft. Juicy J)
songs.title: She Knows

description.plain: “She Knows” is the second single from the album, released on September 16, 2014. This song adds a more ratchet sound to his catalogue of hits as he sings about a girl who knows she has all the goods. He gets some assistance from the trippy man himself, Juicy J, a perfect fit for this particular sound.

songs.full_title: Mad by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Mad

description.plain: This song starts off with them argueing and one of the kids gets hit by a car. Everything starts going down hill after that. Neyo wants to talk to her but she does not want to because they both don’t want to argue anymore. He talks about going to sleep but he wants them to go to bed knowing that they are both on good terms. They have a funeral for the kid in the video and the mother is crying so hard but it’s something that we all have to go through. He hates how they won’t talk and he wants that to change. At the end we find out that it was him that got hit by the car. But all is well eventually.

description.plain: She Got Her Own, also known as Miss Independent Part 2, is the official remix of Ne-Yo’s Platinum smash hit Miss Independent. The song features singer/comedian Jamie Foxx and rapper Fabolous, and continues the theme of self-sufficient women. The song samples Donna Summer’s “My Baby Understands”.

songs.full_title: Closer by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Closer

description.plain:
“Closer” is a dancefloor anthem in which Ne-Yo gives himself fully to an entrancing woman under the dim lights and aggressive beat. It appears to be an invitation to a physical relationship.

The music video features Ne-Yo performing choreographed routines in a classy hat and expensive suit. It was another smash for him, reaching number 7 on the US Billboard 100 and being certified 2 times platinum in the US, and platinum in both New Zealand and Australia. It charted well worldwide.

description.plain:
“Let Me Love You (Until You Learn to Love Yourself)” is a song by American singer and songwriter Ne-Yo, released as the second lead single from his fifth studio album, R.E.D.

The song was a massive hit in the US, peaking at #7 on the Billboard Hot 100 in 2012. This marked the first time in four years that Ne-Yo had a top 10 single on the Billboard Hot 100, the last one being “Miss independent” which peaked at #7 in 2008,

songs.full_title: GOOD MAN by Ne-Yo
songs.title: GOOD MAN

description.plain:
Over a slow guitar-driven beat, Ne-Yo croons  to his girl about wanting to  be a ‘ good man’, promising to “give [her]  things to be the man [she] deserves”  and reassuring her that they’re ‘gonna be alright’ as they’re “making love after every fight” because “what [they] got is beyond all that”.

The song– which samples “Untitled (How Does It Feel)” by D’Angelo–serves as the second single and also the title track for his upcoming studio album.

songs.full_title: Go on Girl by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Go on Girl

description.plain:
“Go on Girl” is the fourth and final single from Ne-Yo’s second studio album, released on December 4, 2007. The song was written by Ne-Yo, Tor Erik Hermansen, Mikkel S. Eriksen, Espen Lind, and Amund Bjorklund, it peaked at #27 on the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart (Billboard) and #96 on the Billboard Hot 100. It became Ne-Yo’s tenth top forty hit.

On Ne-Yo’s episode of VH1’s Behind The Music series, he reveals that Michael Jackson called him in 2009 asking for him to help him with his newest album. Michael told him that his favorite song by Ne-Yo was “Go On Girl.”

description.plain: Another Love Song is the first lead single from his upcoming fourth album, set to be called “Good Man”, and is scheduled to be released in upcoming October. This song is released on 30 May 2017, by Motown Records and is a classic, feel-good song that celebrates the blinding bliss of falling in love.

songs.full_title: Religious / Ratchet Wit Yo Friends by Ne-Yo
songs.title: Religious / Ratchet Wit Yo Friends

description.plain:
On, “Religious,” Ne-Yo joins a long list of R&B veterans who fused both gospel and secular references within a song or album. To most traditional good church going folks, singing about love-making or praising the female anatomy is sacrilegious!

Unfortunately for them yet fortunate for us Ne-Yo has provided such a song. “Religious,” allows us the listeners to truly appreciate our significant others in thanking God for such a beautiful creation.

Even the famed Reverend Brown Miss Black Awareness Pageant taught us that is was okay to appreciate and praise the beauty in women. So sit back and get “Religious.”
